Synopsis:
Bhumika is the story of Usha (Smita Patil), a girl born in a family of Devadasis and groomed in classical music by her Grandmother. Her father dies early and Her mother Shanta (Sulabha Deshpande) become dependent on Keshav (Amol Palekar) a man much older than her. Perhaps its her dependancy on keshav, or perhaps because he was always there to support her as a child, Usha marries Keshav and even bears him a daughter. Keshav takes Usha to the city, where thanks to her singing and her vivacity, she lands roles in films. In a short while she becomes the sole breadwinner of the family supplanting Keshav, whose businesses have not done well.

But Keshav, fanned by film magazine gossip, starts doubting Usha. Fed up with domestic violence, Usha leaves her mother and daughter and seeks refuge with the film hero Rajan (Anant Nag). Then comes a series of relationships with Sunil Verma the Director (naseeruddin Shah), a producer (Kulbhushan Kharbanda) and finally a rich businessman (Om Puri) who treats her as a trophy second wife and robs her of her basic freedoms. All the while her career flourishes but Usha is desperately unhappy.

In desperation she turns to Keshav, who finally brings her home to her daughter.
